abstract: Before you grab that a new case for your Verizon iPhone, makes sure it fits—not all cases made for the original AT&T iPhone 4 will fit the Verizon model.

abstract: Done properly, an embed requires at least one week with a small unit, usually a platoon or company, and going out with them every day.

abstract: Still awaiting regulatory approval and facing opposition from a number of shareholders, the chemical giant buys some time for a deal.

abstract: J. Hilburn, an online tailor, offers customized clothing directly from its Web site.

abstract: Vanisha Mittal Bhatia — the only daughter of the world’s fifth-richest man, Lakshmi Mittal — and her husband, Amit Bhatia, purchased a sizable stake in the quantitative hedge fund.

headline: Sheen Eyes Quick Return to Sitcom, Publicist Says
abstract: The publicist for Charlie Sheen says the actor may complete rehabilitation much sooner than expected and be back on his hit CBS comedy, “Two and a Half Men,” by the end of February.

headline: Continuing the Conversation on Free Trade

abstract: Economic desperation has helped reshape how we think about the regulation of many social issues — including policies related to state-sanctioned gambling, marijuana, immigration and even prostitution.

headline: Davos Looks to Emerging Markets
abstract: A Reuters correspondent, Sonia Legg, says that global business leaders are pinning their hopes on roaring growth in emerging markets at the start of the World Economic Forum.

headline: With High Demand, iPad 2 Goes on Sale in 25 Countries
abstract: While the Apple iPad 2 is still difficult to acquire in the United States, Apple said the new device will go on sale in 25 countries around the globe on Friday.

abstract: A new report released Thursday by Nielsen, a market research firm, said that the Google Android platform had become the most popular operating system among United States smartphone users.

abstract: James C. Woolery will become the co-head of JPMorgan’s North American mergers business.

abstract: The retailer announced that it will continue to solicit higher takeover offers until Feb. 15 as part of a settlement with a group of shareholders.

abstract: A Japanese programmer hacked a Microsoft Kinect and a Roomba robot cleaner to create a wireless vacuum cleaner.

abstract: Instagram, the popular mobile photo-sharing Web service currently available on Apple’s mobile platform, announced $7 million in funding on Wednesday.

headline: How a Gift Card Can Cut Your Tuition Bill

abstract: Vinod Gupta is accused of stiffing Blackstone after his former company, now called Infogroup, was acquired last year in a $460 million acquisition by the private equity firm CCMP.

abstract: 3net, a joint venture between Discovery, Sony and IMAX, will begin broadcasting on Sunday night, one day before ESPN turns ESPN 3D into a 24-hour channel.

abstract: Microsoft’s research chief says the Kinect is “the first incarnation of the next big thing in computing.”
